statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.name: freeThrows
statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.name: offensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.

article.headline: Boston U. 58
article.story: BOSTON (AP) -- Carlos Strong scored 20 points and Scott Brittain added 15 points and 15 rebounds as Boston University held off a second half rally and beat Hartford on Saturday, 58-51. The Terriers led by 11 at halftime, but Hartford knocked the lead down to one point twice in the second half before BU took control in the final minutes. Bo Taylor led Hartford with 12 points while Alex Zimnickas scored 11. Boston University (9-12, 6-3 America East) outrebounded Hartford 35-21 and was 19 of 28 from the free throw lane as it picked up its sixth win in eight games. Tyler Morris scored 15 points for the Terriers. Hartford (9-14, 3-7) dropped its seventh straight game, despite making 10 of 19 shots from the field in the second half. Boston University went on a 18-2 first half run and took a 32-21 lead at intermission. BU led 39-30 with 15:43 remaining, but Hartford went on a 10-2 run, capped by a Bo Taylor jump shot with 9:38 left, that cut the BU lead to 41-40. A pair of Brittain free throws gave BU a 46-42 lead, but another Taylor jump shot, cut the BU lead to 46-45 with 4:16 left. Boston University put the game away with 12-6 run, including a 3-pointer by Strong and a three point play by Morris.
